onset.Description: Onset of clip relative to full film file

Sad.Instructions: Sadness is the response to the loss of an object or a person to which you are attached. Move the gauge up as you feel more sad. Move it down as you do not feel sad

Oppose.Description: You wanted to oppose someone or something (situation)
Oppose.Instructions: Move the gauge up if you want to oppose someone, something or the situation as a whole. Move the gauge down if you do not feel an urge to oppose someone or something.

Surprise.Instructions: Surprise is the response to sudden expected events. For example, you may experience surprise when you are in unusual situations or someone acts unexpectedly. Move the gauge up as you feel more surprised. Move it down as you feel less surprise.

Disgust.Instructions: Disgust is the response to sights, situations, and actions that we do not accept. For example, you may experience disgust when someone behaves in a way that you disapprove. Move the gauge up as you feel disgusted. Move it down as you do not feel disgusted.

Smile.Instructions: Move the gauge up as you observe yourself smiling. Move it down as you are not smiling.
